author: Staff Reporter
text:
Ethiraj College for Women celebrated the 125th birth anniversary of their founder V.L. Ethiraj on Friday. The college unveiled their open-air theatre — Shri VL Ethiraj Quasquicentennial Colosseum.

M.S. Swaminathan, chairman, M.S. Swaminathan Research Foundation (MSSRF), presided over the event and delivered the VL Ethiraj Endowment lecture where he spoke about battling hunger and malnutrition.

“Every student has a major role to play in fighting hunger and malnutrition. Each of you is a torchbearer of social justice and equality,’ he said.

The college officials later called upon members from their newly created 125-member student body: “We have an existing student body but the new one will focus on other areas like empowerment and culture,” said A Nirmala, Principal and Secretary of the college.

V.M. Muralidharan, Chairman, Board of Trustees, was also present at the event.
title: Fight malnutrition, students told
